questions.text: How was Alex able to overcome the mind control?
questions.correct: Hank brought her mother to National City and she talked her through it.
options: She had a device in her ear that changed the signals sent from Myriad.
Supergirl used her powers to interrupt the signal sent to Alex.
Kara knocked her out and when she woke up she was no longer affected.
questions.explanation:
Hank brought her mother to National City and she talked her through it.

	"We are a family, stronger together," her mother said. "I believe in you". During that speech Alex regained control and put the lead shields over the exposed Kryptonite in her suit, blocking the effects on Supergirl.

questions.text: What was Supergirl's plan to beat Myriad?
questions.correct: Broadcast a signal of hope to the people.
options: Destroy all of the satellites broadcasting the signal.
Destroy Indigo and hope that stopped it.
Force Non to shut it down.
Broadcast a signal of hope to the people.
questions.explanation:
Broadcast a signal of hope to the people.

	Supergirl wanted to give a speech while broadcasting to the people. Alex confirmed that while under Myriad control she could hear and understand, but not control her own actions.

questions.text: Who was the first person who broke through the mind control during Supergirl's plan?
questions.explanation:
Winn.

	He stopped typing away at his computer and looked up at the monitor with Supergirl on it. James, Lucy and many others slowly came out of it as well. The image on screen switched between Supergirl herself and her family crest.

questions.text: Indigo wanted to kill all the humans on Earth.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After Myriad failed she talked Non into killing everyone and Leaving Kara as the last being on Earth. They would then move on to another world and work to take over that one.

questions.text: After Myriad failed why didn't Superman help stop Non?
options: He was too weak to fight.
He had to attend to a crisis in Metropolis.
He was ineffective do to a Kryptonite bullet.
questions.explanation:
He was left unconscious.

	There was a shot of his boots while he laid in a medical bay, and mention that they didn't know why he wasn't healing. Likely it was because other than one time early in the season Supergirl had been left on her own to learn to be a hero.

questions.text: What secret was Alex keeping from her mother?
options: That she was in the DEO.
That Hank Henshaw had killed Alex's father.
questions.explanation:
That Jeremiah Danvers was alive.

	It had been 10 years since Danvers had been presumed dead. Alex had known he was alive for a few episodes but that information was kept under wraps. Only Hank, Kara, and Alex knew. Danver's was Alex's dad.

questions.text: What celebrity did Cat Grant model her diet after?
questions.explanation:
Gwyneth Paltrow.

	Ironically enough, Gwyneth played a character in the "Iron Man" movies. Cat wanted a smoothie like the one Gwyneth was always talking about. She told Kara that she wanted one every two hours. Flockhart is the actress who played Cat and she married Harrison Ford in 2010.

questions.text: During the fight on Fort Rozz, who ripped Indigo in half?
questions.explanation:
J'onn J'onzz.

	He took on the female Indigo while Supergirl took on the male Non. During the fight J'onn ripped Indigo in half, though because of the nature of the character, she isn't necessarily dead.

questions.text: At the end of the season, who was the head of the DEO?
questions.explanation:
J'onn.

	The DEO had been lead by J'onn (acting as Hank Henshaw), Alex, Sam Lane, Lucy Lane, and then J'onn again during the 20 episodes of the season. He was reinstated after receiving a presidential pardon.

questions.text: James gave Kara a photo at the end of the episode. What did he do after she opened it?
options: Nothing, the episode faded to black.
Walked out of the room crying.
questions.explanation:
He kissed her.

	She had kissed him a few episodes earlier. The show cut to black after that, leaving their relationship as the season ending cliffhanger.
